author: P V
text:
Collector C. Kathiravan visiting injured children at Krishnagiri Government Hospital on Wednesday.

Fourteen students escaped with minor injuries after their school bus had a brush with a lorry on the Krishnagiri Highway on Wednesday.

The children, students of Nalanda Matriculation Higher Secondary School here, were being driven to the school in a mini bus at the time of the accident.

The mini bus was taking a turn along Krishnagiri- Dharmapuri stretch near Mottur, when the iron-rod laden lorry from Bengaluru, proceeding to Salem, hit the mini bus.

All the 14 children suffered minor injuries, and were rushed to Krishnagiri Government Hospital here. Nawas Priyan, a six-year-old boy, who suffered a minor head impact, was referred to a private hospital in Bengaluru for further investigation.

Collector C. Kathiravan visited the children at the hospital.

The driver abandoned the lorry and escaped from the scene. Police are on the lookout for the driver.
title: School students injured in accident
